data.actual_result: Google Smart Lock is triggered on channels named such as `#username`, `#password`, `#email`, `#mobile`, etc
data.expected_result: Google Smart Lock should never flag the chat textfield as a username or password field
data.short_description: Google Smart Lock autofill is triggered in chat textfield when the channel has a specific name
data.steps_to_repro: - Enable Google Smart Lock autofill service in your phone settings (I think it's only available on Android 6+) - Go to User settings > My account, change your password and go back. If you did step 1 correctly, it should prompt you to save your password in Smart Lock. Accept. - Create a new text channel, and name it `#password` - Send a message mentionning the channel (`#password`) and click the channel link to jump to it - Focus the textfield and try to send a message
